content.question: Which of the following would be most effective at preventing sediment runoff into the streams of the watershed?

choices.label: Have construction crews steepen the slopes of the valleys of streams near roadwork zones.

Maintain zones of grass at least <math alttext="100 meters" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></math> wide on the sides of streams in the area.
Construct at least one dam on a stream in the watershed to improve flood control.

Shift from dairy farming to corn planted in agricultural fields located within <math alttext="100 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of streams.

content.answer: Maintain zones of grass at least <math alttext="100 meters" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></math> wide on the sides of streams in the area.
